definitions: spoken or written words that have no meaning or make no logical sense
behavior or actions that are foolish, absurd, or lacking in good judgment
examples: The toddler babbled complete nonsense while playing with his toys
Don't believe that nonsense about ghosts haunting the old mansion
Stop this nonsense and focus on your homework immediately
I won't tolerate any more nonsense during the meeting today

definitions: relating to drugs that reduce inflammation and pain without containing steroid hormones
examples: The doctor prescribed nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs for her arthritis
Many athletes use nonsteroidal medications to manage their pain

definitions: a flight or journey that goes directly from one place to another without stopping
continuing without pause or interruption for an extended period of time
examples: We booked a nonstop flight from New York to London
The nonstop train service reduced travel time by three hours
The rain fell nonstop for three days straight without pause
She worked nonstop until the project deadline was met

definitions: the practice of achieving goals through peaceful means without using physical force or aggression
examples: Gandhi's philosophy of nonviolence inspired civil rights movements worldwide
The protesters committed to nonviolence despite facing aggressive opposition

definitions: a thin strip of pasta made from flour, water, and sometimes eggs
informal term for a person's head or brain when thinking
examples: She ordered chicken noodle soup to warm up on the cold day
The recipe calls for thick rice noodles and fresh vegetables
Use your noodle to figure out this puzzle yourself
That idea has been bouncing around my noodle all day

definitions: a small, sheltered, or hidden space, especially a cozy corner in a room
examples: She created a reading nook with cushions by the window
The cat found a warm nook behind the couch to sleep

definitions: twelve o'clock in the middle of the day when the sun is highest
examples: The meeting is scheduled for noon in the conference room
The church bells ring every day at noon without fail

definitions: a loop with a running knot that tightens as the rope is pulled
examples: The cowboy prepared a noose to catch the runaway horse
They found an old noose hanging in the abandoned barn

definitions: a standard or pattern regarded as typical or usual in a group or society
a mathematical function that assigns a positive length or size to vectors
examples: Working from home has become the norm in many tech companies
Social norms vary significantly between different cultures and countries
Calculate the norm of this vector using the standard formula
The norm of the matrix determines its scaling properties

definitions: the usual, typical, or expected state or condition of something
a line perpendicular to a surface or another line in geometry
examples: Everything returned to normal after the storm passed through town
It's normal to feel nervous before a job interview
Draw a normal to the curve at the point of tangency
The normal vector determines the orientation of the surface

definitions: the condition of being normal, usual, or expected in everyday life
examples: The town slowly returned to normalcy after the natural disaster
She craved normalcy after months of constant travel and change

definitions: the process of making something conform to a standard or returning it to a normal state
examples: Database normalisation reduces redundancy and improves data integrity significantly
The normalisation of diplomatic relations took several years to achieve

definitions: the state or condition of being normal, ordinary, or usual
a measure of concentration in chemistry equal to gram equivalent weight per liter
examples: The psychiatrist assessed the patient's return to normality after treatment
A sense of normality returned to the classroom after the disruption
Calculate the normality of the sodium hydroxide solution for titration
The normality determines the number of equivalents per liter

definitions: the process of organizing data or making something conform to a standard or norm
examples: Data normalization is essential before training machine learning models effectively
The normalization of trade relations benefited both countries economically

definitions: the direction toward the top of maps, opposite to south
the northern part of a country, continent, or specified area
examples: The compass needle always points toward magnetic north consistently
We drove north for three hours to reach the mountains
The North experienced heavy snowfall during the winter months
Industry was concentrated in the North during the nineteenth century

definitions: the direction halfway between north and east on a compass
the northeastern part of a country or specified geographical area
examples: The storm is moving northeast at twenty miles per hour
Their house faces northeast to catch the morning sunlight
The Northeast has distinct seasons with cold winters and humid summers
Many prestigious universities are located in the Northeast United States

definitions: toward or in the direction of the northeast
examples: The migrating birds flew northeastward following their ancient route
The river flows northeastward before joining the larger tributary

definitions: situated in or toward the north direction
a wind that blows from the north
examples: The ship maintained a northerly course despite rough seas
They chose the most northerly route to avoid bad weather
A cold northerly brought freezing temperatures to the region overnight
Strong northerlies made sailing conditions particularly challenging today

definitions: the northern regions of a country or the lands in the far north
examples: The northland experiences months of continuous daylight in summer
Ancient peoples of the northland developed unique survival techniques

definitions: toward or in the direction of the north
examples: The expedition continued northward despite worsening weather conditions
Temperatures drop as you travel northward from the equator

definitions: the direction halfway between north and west on a compass
the northwestern part of a country or specified geographical area
examples: The plane flew northwest to avoid the storm system
The cabin is located northwest of the main lodge
The Pacific Northwest is known for its rainy climate and forests
Trade routes connected the Northwest with eastern markets historically

definitions: toward or in the direction of the northwest
examples: The hurricane tracked northwestward along the Atlantic coast slowly
They sailed northwestward searching for the legendary passage

definitions: the organ on the face used for breathing and smelling
the front part or projection of something, especially a vehicle
examples: She broke her nose playing basketball at school yesterday
The dog's wet nose pressed against the window eagerly
The nose of the airplane dipped as it began its descent
The ship's nose cut through the waves effortlessly

definitions: a sentimental longing or wistful affection for a past period or place
examples: Looking through old photos filled her with nostalgia for childhood
The song triggered powerful nostalgia for his college years

definitions: either of the two external openings of the nose
examples: The horse's nostrils flared as it galloped across the field
She covered one nostril to clear her sinuses effectively

definitions: the quality of being worthy of attention, remarkable, or famous
examples: The scientist achieved notability for her groundbreaking cancer research
The building's notability comes from its unique architectural design

definitions: a person of distinction or great reputation in a particular field
examples: Local notables attended the charity gala to support the cause
Several notables from the art world praised the exhibition

definitions: a public official authorized to witness signatures and certify documents
examples: The notary verified our signatures on the property deed
You'll need a notary to authenticate this legal document

definitions: a system of written symbols used to represent numbers, amounts, or elements
a brief written note or annotation added to text
examples: Musical notation allows composers to record their compositions precisely
The mathematician used standard notation to express the equation
She made a notation in the margin about the source
The editor's notations helped clarify the manuscript's meaning

definitions: a V-shaped cut or indentation on an edge or surface
a level or degree in a scale of measurement or quality
examples: He carved a notch in the tree to mark the trail
The arrow fits perfectly into the notch of the bow
The restaurant raised its service up a notch this year
Her performance was several notches above the competition

definitions: a brief written message or reminder
a single musical sound of definite pitch and duration
a piece of paper money issued by a bank
a quality or characteristic that is observed or mentioned
examples: She left a note on the refrigerator about dinner plans
The student took careful notes during the important lecture
The pianist played each note with perfect precision and feeling
Hold that note for four beats before moving on
He paid with a twenty pound note at the shop
The old bank note was worth much more to collectors
There was a note of sadness in her voice today
The wine has notes of cherry and oak

definitions: a book with blank pages for writing notes or recording information
a portable computer that opens like a book
examples: She filled her notebook with observations during the nature walk
Students need a separate notebook for each subject this semester
His notebook computer fits easily in his backpack for travel
The notebook has enough battery life for the entire flight

definitions: a pad of paper for writing quick notes or memos
a simple computer program for creating and editing plain text files
examples: Keep a notepad by the phone for important messages
The waiter wrote our order on his notepad quickly
Open Notepad to edit the configuration file on Windows
She used Notepad to write code before getting specialized software

definitions: a written or printed announcement or advertisement displayed publicly
the act of observing or paying attention to something
advance notification or warning about something that will happen
examples: The notice on the board announced the meeting cancellation
She posted a notice about the lost cat around town
His strange behavior didn't escape the teacher's notice today
The change in weather patterns deserves our immediate notice
You must give two weeks' notice before leaving your job
The landlord served notice that rent would increase next month

definitions: a message or alert informing someone about something
an official or formal announcement of something
examples: She received a notification on her phone about the package delivery
Email notifications keep employees informed about system updates
The bank sent official notification of the account closure
Notification of the merger was sent to all shareholders

definitions: a conception, belief, or opinion about something
small items used in sewing such as buttons, thread, and zippers
examples: She had a vague notion that something was wrong today
The notion of time travel fascinates many scientists worldwide
The fabric store sells notions in the back aisle
She bought several notions to complete her sewing project

definitions: the state of being famous or well-known, typically for something bad
examples: The criminal gained notoriety after the high-profile bank robbery
The restaurant achieved notoriety for its terrible service and food

definitions: a sweet made from sugar, honey, nuts, and egg white
examples: The candy bar contains layers of chocolate and soft nougat
French nougat traditionally includes almonds and pistachios

definitions: a word used to identify people, places, things, or ideas
examples: In the sentence, 'cat' functions as a common noun
Proper nouns like 'London' always begin with capital letters

definitions: food and other substances necessary for growth, health, and good condition
examples: The patient needs proper nourishment to recover from surgery
Plants draw nourishment from the soil through their roots

definitions: a long written story about imaginary characters and events
examples: She spent the weekend reading a mystery novel by the fireplace
The novel won several literary awards for its unique narrative

definitions: a short novel or long short story, typically light or romantic
examples: The magazine published her romantic novelette in three installments
He preferred reading novelettes to full-length novels

definitions: the process or result of converting a film or script into novel form
examples: The novelisation of the movie included additional character backstory
She specializes in writing novelisations of popular television shows

definitions: a person who writes novels as a profession or hobby
examples: The novelist spent three years researching her historical fiction
Famous novelists often draw inspiration from personal experiences

definitions: the process or result of converting a film or script into novel form
examples: The novelization expanded on scenes cut from the final film
Movie novelizations often reveal characters' internal thoughts

definitions: a written fictional narrative longer than a short story but shorter than a novel
examples: The author's novella explored themes of isolation and redemption beautifully
Many famous novellas have been adapted into successful films

definitions: the quality of being new, original, or unusual
a small and inexpensive toy or ornament
examples: The novelty of working from home wore off after several months
Her innovative approach brought novelty to the traditional field
The shop sells novelties and souvenirs to tourists year-round
Children love the novelty items from party gift bags

definitions: a person new to or inexperienced in a field or activity
examples: The cooking class was designed specifically for complete novices
Even a novice can learn to code with proper guidance

definitions: a projecting spout or outlet designed to control the flow of liquid or gas
examples: Adjust the nozzle on the hose for a wider spray pattern
The fuel nozzle automatically stops when the tank is full

definitions: a subtle difference in meaning, expression, or response that requires careful attention
examples: Understanding cultural nuances is essential for effective international business
The actor captured every nuance of the complex character perfectly
